pullRequest.body:
- Add definition of `EReal.toENNReal`.
- Add some API lemmas for `toENNReal`.
- Add measurability and continuity lemmas for `toENNReal`.




---

This is already covered by [EReal.left_distrib_of_nonneg](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Real/EReal.html#EReal.left_distrib_of_nonneg). Same issue with the following three lemmas.

I have been working on this lately. I think it would be better to have something like `{x y z : EReal} (h :  0 â‰¤ x) (h' : x â‰  âŠ¤)`. There are many ways to coerce something into EReal, and your version might be annoying to work with if `x` is e.g. a Nat, a NNReal... On the other hand, if we have a general version on EReal, we can easily deduce any specialized version using various forms on `coe_ne_top`.

pullRequest.title: feat(EReal): add `toENNReal`
